item.title: Hopes new Australian fabric will revitalise domestic clothing manufacturing
item.description: Scientists, farmers and the fashion industry collaborate to create a natural fabric that is both woven and knitted, low on emissions and set to shake up how we think about clothing.

item.title: NSW psychiatrists win 20 per cent pay rise in industrial relations commission ruling
item.description: The NSW Industrial Relations Commission has delivered its decision in a wages dispute between the state's public psychiatrists and the government.

item.title: Top six bugs nominated for 2025 ABC Australian Insect of the Year
item.description: Whether you love beetles or the giant mantis it's time to cast your vote for Australia's top insect.

item.title: Officers wrap up police operation in Sydney's south-west following reports of a person carrying a gun
item.description: NSW Police said a member of the public reported seeing four people, one of whom appeared to be carrying a gun, leave a dark-coloured sedan or station wagon and go into a home on the street.

item.title: New Melbourne flood mapping sparks outrage from inner-city council
item.description: The City of Yarra mayor has lashed the government over the mapping, saying residents will bear the costs of inadequate infrastructure investment.

item.title: Tony Mokbel acquitted of some drug convictions but faces a retrial
item.description: The drug kingpin has had a mixed result in his appeal against three convictions, with a possible retrial looming.

item.title: Disability employment provider Bedford kept afloat with $4.4m funding injection as hunt for buyer continues
item.description: Australia's second-largest disability employment provider Bedford will be kept afloat by a $4.4 million federal government funding injection as it seeks a buyer for the embattled business.

item.title: South Australian Riverland welcomes summer tourists avoiding algal bloom
item.description: An algal bloom causing toxic foam and fish kills along South Australia's beaches prompts holiday-makers to consider alternative summer travel plans.

item.title: Tasmanian tractor convoy unable to break stalemate on potato farmer pay
item.description: Tasmanian potato farmers have rejected a second pay offer from multinational processor Simplot that would see farmers paid less per kilo than last year.

item.title: AEC launches legal action against man accused of distributing unauthorised pamphlets attacking Allegra Spender
item.description: The Australian Electoral Commission has launched legal action against a finance executive and Wentworth constituent in relation to 47,000 unauthorised pamphlets which were distributed in the electorate during the 2025 election campaign.

item.title: Understanding the grief of euthanising a pet after Lewis Hamilton's dog's death
item.description: Vets and counsellors say owners can prepare for and address the complicated grief that can come with euthanasing a pet.

item.title: Murder accused former police officer Beau Lamarre-Condon makes courtroom outburst
item.description: Former NSW Police officer Beau Lamarre-Condon tells a Supreme Court judge that he "will not be silenced" and declared "the truth will prevail".

item.title: Prisoner who bit off opponent's ear after volleyball game to spend extra time in jail
item.description: A prisoner has been sentenced to additional jail time, after admitting to biting off part of the ear of another inmate during a fight after a volleyball game.

item.title: Ben Hunt's Brisbane Broncos return comes full circle with shot at NRL grand final redemption
item.description: The Broncos have had their share of NRL grand final heartache over the years, but no-one feels it quite as acutely as Ben Hunt

item.title: Brett Button appeals 32-year sentence over Hunter Valley bus crash
item.description: Lawyers for the driver of a bus that crashed in the New South Wales Hunter Valley, killing 10 people, have detailed his appeal against a 32-year sentence.

item.title: Is Israel breaking international law by seizing humanitarian ships bound for Gaza?
item.description: According to a UN legal framework, a nation's territory does not extend beyond 19km from its shores but enforcing international maritime law is a challenge across the globe.

item.title: Case against Molly Ticehurst's alleged domestic violence murderer Daniel Billings adjourned
item.description: Daniel Billings's defence lawyer tells the court negotiations are in a "fragile place", as the case over the alleged murder of the 28-year-old mother is adjourned.

item.title: Police scale back search for missing 4yo boy Gus in outback South Australia
item.description: South Australian Police are scaling back the search for a four-year-old boy, who disappeared in the state’s mid-north almost a week ago.

item.title: South Korea’s president apologises on Facebook for poorly managed foreign adoption programs
item.description: South Korea President Lee Jae Myung apologises for poorly managed foreign adoption programs that were rife with abuses and fraud, months after the country’s truth commission admits state responsibilities for such practices for the first time.

item.title: Saints take Blues' Jack Silvagni and Tom De Koning as AFL free agency period begins
item.description: Clubs move to formalise deals as the free agency period gets underway, while a series of big names could be on the move in next week's trade period.

item.title: Pro-Palestinian protesters told Sydney Opera House 'off-limits' for planned rally
item.description: NSW Police says the location and expected scale of the rally planned by the Palestinian Action Group poses public safety concerns.

item.title: US investigators launch review into 2005 death of journalist and author Hunter S Thompson
item.description: A Colorado sheriff says his office wants to address lingering questions surrounding the author's death.

item.title: Queensland doctors provide rural health road map at generalist forum
item.description: More than 150 medical practitioners and stakeholders gather in Roma to discuss the future of rural generalist medicine.

item.title: Carnarvon locals help rescue tourist hit by 'king wave' along Quobba coastline
item.description: Quick-thinking locals leapt into action after a tourist in WA's north was swept into the ocean while rock fishing. A rescue in rough seas and "pitch-black" conditions ensued.

item.title: How long will the government shutdown last? Here's what history tells us
item.description: While shutdowns have been a possibility since 1976, when Congress introduced the modern budget process, they've been a relatively rare occurrence. Here's a look at how previous shutdowns have played out.

item.title: Rohen Hanson sentenced to 28 years in prison for murder of partner Dee Annear
item.description: Rohen James Hanson will spend at least the next 17 years behind bars for murdering his partner in a remote cabin on the NSW Mid North Coast in 2021.

item.title: Thriving Kids autism service causing 'significant anxiety', Labor MP warns, and may need changing
item.description: A Labor MP puts his party on notice after a hearing into the proposed 'Thriving Kids' autism service delivers little detail, warning that the lack of information is causing families "significant anxiety".

item.title: Women and children stranded in Syria return to Australia after smuggling themselves from country
item.description: A small group of Australian women who travelled or were taken to Syria as partners of Islamic State members, as well as their children, have managed to smuggle themselves out of the country and have now returned home, after years of being stranded overseas.

item.title: Diamonds chasing polished performance against 'confident' Proteas in three-Test series ahead of 2026 Commonwealth Games
item.description: The Diamonds are way of South Africa ahead of their three-Test series, which kicks off in Bendigo on Saturday night.

item.title: Cheryl Grimmer's family faces setback as police search ends with no result
item.description: A renewed search for the remains of three-year-old Cheryl Grimmer in Wollongong ends without results, leaving her family facing fresh heartbreak.

item.title: Rapist restaurateur Alberto Nicoletti jailed for sexually assaulting woman he drove home from South Perth
item.description: Como restaurateur Alberto Nicoletti is sentenced for raping a woman he offered to drive home from South Perth, his third sexual assault conviction.

item.title: Man arrested after gaining 'unauthorised' access to Amberley RAAF base
item.description: The ABC has confirmed an "unauthorised man" was able to enter the Royal Australian Air Force base south-west of Brisbane in September before being arrested by police.

item.description: The Broncos expect the NRLW grand final to have a State of Origin feel as they look to halt the Sydney Roosters' perfect season.

item.description: Police have confirmed they have located two women dead at Nelse, near Falls Creek in Victoria's alpine area.

item.description: A teenager dies after being pulled from the water following a boating accident in the regional city of Bunbury, south of Perth.

item.title: Taylor Swift's The Life of a Showgirl in the spotlight, a track-by-track look
item.description: Taylor Swift's new album The Life of a Showgirl will be deconstructed by critics and fans alike, probably for some time to come. Here we get an expert Swiftie's initial reaction.

item.description: Shadow Home Affairs Minister and Liberal leadership aspirant Andrew Hastie has quit Sussan Ley's shadow ministry, citing a disagreement over the party's immigration policy.

item.title: Australia retains Chappell-Hadlee Trophy after rain washes out second T20I against New Zealand
item.description: The second men's Twenty20I between New Zealand and Australia is abandoned because of rain, with only 13 deliveries bowled at Tauranga's Bay Oval.

item.description: Melbourne has continued its pursuit of a top two AFLW finish with a 14 point defeat of Essendon at Princes Park.

item.title: Ekkalak Paenoi sentenced to life in prison for Lim Kimya's murder but his widow wants to know who ordered the killing
item.description: Lim Kimya was gunned down shortly after arriving in Bangkok earlier this year by Ekkalak Paenoi, but his widow is questioning who is behind her husband's death.

item.title: A West Bank town symbolises the hurdles to Palestinian statehood

item.description: Research by Federation University has found 63 per cent of girls have missed training, and a third have missed competitions, because of period-related challenges in athletics and swimming.

item.description: Without providing evidence, Pete Hegseth says the intelligence "without a doubt" confirms that the vessel was carrying drugs and that the people on board were "narco-terrorists".

item.description: The man tasked with reviewing WA's "old and depleted" hospitals says building a brand new one will not fix a snowballing health crisis.

item.title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs sentenced to 50 months' prison after offering tearful apologies in court

item.description: Not many players can be like Cameron Munster and Reece Walsh except for one another, and that's why they hold the fate of the 2025 NRL grand final in their hands.

item.description: Advocates say an outdated funding model and cost shifting has left Queensland councils in a risky financial position, with nowhere left to turn for cash except ratepayers.

item.description: Australian Oscar Piastri quickly bounces back from his Baku nightmare to set the fastest time on the first day of practice at the Singapore Grand Prix.

item.description: A film starring Dave Franco and Alison Brie, Together, is pulled from China after AI censorship of a queer couple in early screenings.

item.description: A new project is collecting thousands of messages destined for the cosmos, coinciding with the anniversary of a landmark space mission 50 years ago.

item.description: Carlton's emergence as a finals threat is no surprise, with the Blues now possessing the personnel to execute an effective game plan.

item.description: A week of large-scale land and air searches have found no clues leading to the whereabouts of four-year-old Gus in outback South Australia.

item.description: Southern and eastern Australia are forecast to see a surge of summer-like warmth, as high fire danger warnings are issued across several parts of the country.

item.description: The dish is completely unfussy, relying upon two pantry staples, zesty lemon and salty Parmesan, to bring big, punchy flavours.

item.description: With more than 100 members and only four rehearsals before showtime, the Big Lost Band is the ultimate musical challenge.

item.description: A Cairns biotech startup is combining Indigenous knowledge of "rainmaking" with modern science to develop an electrical seed treatment hoping to improve crop growth.

item.description: Hastie says he decided to quit because a letter she sent him earlier in the week made clear he wouldn't be formulating the Coalition's immigration policies.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Mele Hufanga's NRLW premiership-winning try now an unsolvable mystery
item.description: Brisbane and the Roosters played one of the greatest games in NRLW history, but the controversial winning try to Mele Hufanga shapes as a football mystery that might never be solved.

item.title: Dozens dead after landslides, flash floods in Nepal and India's Darjeeling region
item.description: Heavy rain triggers landslides and flash floods, blocking roads, washing away bridges and killing dozens in Nepal and West Bengal, according to authorities.

item.title: F1 Singapore Grand Prix: Lando Norris hits Oscar Piastri on first lap, George Russell wins
item.description: Oscar Piastri has been left furious at his teammate, and his team, after his two drivers' championship rivals gained ground on him in the Formula 1 Singapore Grand Prix.

item.title: Man in critical condition after shooting in Sydney's Croydon Park as police arrest alleged gunman
item.description: NSW Police say the alleged gunman had been "firing indiscriminately at passing vehicles including police vehicles".

item.title: Reece Walsh wins Clive Churchill Medal to ice Broncos' NRL premiership success
item.description: In one of the greatest individual performances in grand final history, Brisbane Broncos star Reece Walsh was judged player of the match after inspiring his side to their victory over the Melbourne Storm.

item.title: NRL grand final quick hits: Reece Walsh rushes to catch a concussed Ben Hunt and Broncos overcome injury toll
item.description: Reece Walsh put in an NRL grand final performance for the ages after an early stroke of luck as the Brisbane Broncos survived the loss of both Ben Hunt and Adam Reynolds to end a 19-year premiership drought.

item.title: How the internet reacted to Brisbane Broncos winning the NRL grand final
item.description: The internet could barely believe what was happening as Brisbane, fuelled by Reece Walsh's brilliance, came from behind to win the NRL grand final.

item.title: Why Brisbane Broncos's NRL premiership win is more about blood than gold
item.description: The Brisbane Broncos are flash and have never made apologies for it but, with their premiership win, they've proven they also have the true steel of champions.

item.title: Australia's de facto online betting regulator accused of being too close to gambling industry
item.description: Four Corners has uncovered allegations of conflicts of interest and pro-industry bias at the country's part-time regulator responsible for Australia's biggest betting companies.

item.title: Spring heatwave creates dangerous fire conditions across Queensland
item.description: Temperatures could soar to almost 10 degrees above average this week, increasing the risk of bushfires that are already burning across the state.

item.title: Inside the mission to rescue dachshund Valerie from wild 529-day Kangaroo Island ordeal
item.description: Valerie's disappearance on South Australia's Kangaroo Island unleashed a 529-day hunt. She dodged rescue attempts and traps and had some wondering whether the sausage dog was mocking them and having the time of her life.

item.title: Documents reveal Australia's F-35 fighter jet export details 'quietly' disappeared
item.description: Department of Defence emails show that a website dedicated to Australia's role in the global F-35 supply chain used by Israel to maintain its fighter jets was removed at the start of the war in Gaza.

item.title: Housing supply without controlling demand suggests National Housing Accord won't fix affordability
item.description: The national project to fix housing affordability is off to a slow start but, from deposit schemes and negative gearing to immigration and construction delays, the reasons are complex.

item.title: Russia launches drone and missile strikes on Ukraine
item.description: Authorities say nine regions across Ukraine were targeted by Russian night-time drone, missile and aerial bomb strikes.

item.title: The fate of Hobart's proposed AFL Macquarie Point stadium rests with a handful of politicians
item.description: The future of Tasmania's proposed Macquarie Point AFL stadium rests in the hands of the state's politicians. So who will vote which way, and what is the chance it will actually get up?

item.title: Melbourne Storm's new normal falls short in NRL grand finals and they're running out of chances
item.description: The new and infinitely more exciting Melbourne Storm are finding out just how hard it is to play their exciting brand of footy when the tension is at its peak.

item.title: SA seafood demand still down as algal bloom safety message struggles to break through
item.description: While industry and government tell consumers South Australian seafood is safe, consumer demand is still down amid the algal bloom, with businesses concerned they may not survive.

item.title: SA foster care providers working to bring more culturally and linguistically diverse carers into the system
item.description: Masooma came to Adelaide as a refugee from Afghanistan in 2016, and has become the carer of a young girl from a similar cultural background. Experts say it is important carers reflected the diversity of children in care.

item.title: The Sydney street workers helping get young people's lives back on track
item.description: Some of Sydney's vulnerable young people are being steered away from a life of crime, addiction and homelessness by a pair of youth workers who have had their own share of hardships.

item.title: Croydon Park shooting prompts strong police response
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: The man most Palestinians want as their leader has spent years in solitary confinement
item.description: Despite spending more than 20 years behind bars, Marwan Barghouti is the man most Palestinians would want as their leader.

item.title: Decades-old 'conversion therapy' resurfaces in today's trans youth healthcare debate
item.description: A decades-old psychiatric study is influencing current debates over transgender youth health care. But a new analysis led by a survivor says the findings were deeply harmful and dangerously misleading.

item.title: Live updates: Wall Street edges higher as US government shutdown continues, ASX gives up early gains
item.description: The ASX has given up earlier gains to be trading flat heading in to the afternoon. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

item.title: Blizzard traps hundreds of hikers on Mount Everest
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Older Territorians say they still feel unsafe as residents' homes targeted by armed thugs
item.description: There are growing calls for the NT government to ban machetes and crossbows as older residents share horror stories of being targeted in their own homes by armed youths.

item.title: East Gippsland volunteer groups left to pick up insurance bill on Crown land
item.description: A council in Victoria's east tells volunteer groups it will no longer pay for their insurance policies, sparking community concerns and raising questions as to whose responsibility it should be.

item.title: Ten years on from 2015, Ben Hunt wins the Broncos premiership he's waited for his whole life
item.description: Defeat in the 2015 decider was so scarring, Hunt eventually felt the need to move away from the club he loves. Ten years later and back in his home colours, he's a 350-game, premiership-winning NRL player.

item.title: Federal politics live: Anthony Albanese and PNG PM James Marape sign landmark defence treaty
item.description: Anthony Albanese and PNG Prime Minister James Marape have signed a landmark defence treaty in Canberra. Follow live.

item.title: Calls to ban machetes as elderly Territorians terrorised in their own homes
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Outback businesses raise concerns about Services Australia's Centrepay reforms
item.description: Business owners worry major changes to a buy now, pay later system used by about 500,000 social security recipients will cause a raft of issues when it begins next month.

item.title: Griffin Coal failure sees WA taxpayers fork out millions to Indian bank, despite government promises
item.description: The WA government is facing fresh questions over its bailout of Griffin Coal — a mine critical to the state's energy system — amid revelations taxpayer money is leaking offshore.

item.title: AFL trade period, day one live updates: Zach Merrett, Charlie Curnow and Christian Petracca on the move
item.description: The 2025 AFL trade period officially kicks off as teams begin negotiations over the futures of some of the biggest names in the competition, headlined by Essendon captain Zach Merrett. Follow live.

item.title: Mount Everest rescue underway after snowstorm traps hundreds of trekkers in Tibet
item.description: Local villagers and rescue teams help hikers stranded on Mount Everest after a snowstorm pummels the Himalayas.

item.title: Vintage cars race on historic Lake Perkolilli track in Red Dust Revival
item.description: A dusty claypan in outback Western Australia is transformed back into a historic race track, as vintage car and motorcycle enthusiasts re-enact races held a century ago.

item.title: Three youths charged with arson after fire at Ashley Youth Detention Centre in northern Tasmania
item.description: Police said they were called to the site on Sunday afternoon following reports of a disturbance involving three armed youths.

item.title: The chicken and egg dilemma fuelling house prices – 6 October 2025
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Former NFL quarterback Mark Sanchez charged after being stabbed in altercation with truck driver
item.description: Fox Sports analyst and former NFL player Mark Sanchez is charged after being stabbed multiple times in an altercation with a truck driver.

item.title: Defiant Ange Postecoglou says he will fight back as Nottingham Forest lose again
item.description: Ange Postecoglou fires up in a post-match press conference after Nottingham Forest lose to Newcastle United 2-0.

item.title: US military deployed to quell Chicago riots
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: NSW flood victims' personal details loaded to ChatGPT in major data breach
item.description: The NSW Reconstruction Authority says the breach occurred in March and involved the personal data of applicants to the Northern Rivers Resilient Homes Program.

item.title: Clients of Melbourne builder MJ Harris Group lose life savings as company goes bust
item.description: More than a dozen customers of MJ Harris Group have told the ABC they have been left significantly out of pocket after the company went into liquidation this week.

item.title: Donald Trump sends Californian National Guard troops to Oregon
item.description: US President Donald Trump deploys at least 200 Californian National Guard troops to Portland after a judge blocks him from deploying local troops in Oregon.

item.title: Reece Walsh's NRL grand-final heroics with Broncos rewarded with Kangaroos call-up
item.description: Recognition of Reece Walsh's breathtaking performance in the NRL grand final continues, with the Brisbane Broncos hero set to make his Test debut for Australia later this month.

item.title: What is task paralysis and how do you overcome it?
item.description: Experts say feeling stuck or frozen when trying to start or complete a task can be the body's response to overwhelm.

item.title: Broncos great Ali Brigginshaw to co-captain Jillaroos after NRLW grand final victory
item.description: Ali Brigginshaw is named as a Jillaroos co-captain after helping steer the Brisbane Broncos to their fourth NRLW premiership.

item.title: As the AFLW begins to even out, North Melbourne remains untouchable
item.description: North Melbourne claims its 20th win in a row as it looks to go undefeated for another season.

item.title: Broncos star Pat Carrigan says a wooden spoon from 2020 helped motivate him for the grand final
item.description: Fans left wooden spoons on Brisbane's training ground in 2020 — it was a move that helped motivate Pat Carrigan to greatness.

item.title: Australia were world champs, now teams are scrambling for players
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Man dead, woman rescued from water tank on Bundaberg's outskirts
item.description: The 64-year-old man has died, and a woman in her 20s is in hospital after becoming trapped in a water tank at a regional Queensland home.

item.title: Canberra man allegedly 'stormed a home', threatened mother and son with taser and demanded prescription drugs
item.description: A man who allegedly "stormed a home" and threatened a mother and son with a taser while demanding prescription drugs and cash will remain in custody.

item.title: Forensics scour Croydon Park shooting scene as NSW Police probe motive
item.description: A suburb in Sydney's inner west was plunged into lockdown overnight after an alleged gunman opened fire on passing cars, including police vehicles.

item.title: Hobart's Brooke Street Pier has sustained damage after a night of wild weather.

item.title: Brooke Street Pier dislodged, shade sail collapses as heavy winds bluster Tasmania
item.description: Wind gusts of about 90 kilometres per hour were measured in Hobart on Sunday afternoon, with the blustery conditions set to continue this week.

item.title: New Zealand pays $5.3 million to Samoa after sinking navy ship Manawanui on pristine reef
item.description: The New Zealand government says it has done "the right thing" in offering a $5.3 million compensation payout to the Samoan government after its navy sunk a ship on a pristine reef off the Pacific island.

item.title: Lando Norris says anyone who criticised his driving after Oscar Piastri incident 'shouldn't be in F1'
item.description: Lando Norris says anyone who criticised his driving at the Singapore Grand Prix "shouldn't be in F1", after Oscar Piastri openly criticised Norris's driving.

item.title: Passengers rescued after V/Line bus crashes near Victorian town of Foster
item.description: A V/Line bus carrying a number of passengers plunges down an embankment in Victoria's south east, prompting a high-angle rescue.

item.title: How much are NRL and NRLW premiership rings worth? What do they look like?
item.description: The men's rings are valued at $15,000, while the women's rings have a price tag of $10,000.

item.title: Nathalie Matthews granted bail after airport arrest over sharing intimate image charges
item.description: Nathalie Matthews, 38, was arrested on Sunday morning after arriving on a flight from Dubai at Sydney Airport.

item.title: Perth obstetrician Rhys Bellinge admits to reckless, dangerous driving days before fatal crash
item.description: Perth obstetrician Rhys Bellinge pleads guilty to more driving offences in two suburbs days before he crashed his car in Dalkeith and killed a 24-year-old woman.

item.title: Why Kangaroos coach Kevin Walters is looking to the past ahead of Ashes series
item.description: New Kangaroos coach Kevin Walters was part of an era where the green and gold jersey was the highest honour rugby league could offer and ahead of the return of the Ashes it's a legacy he's desperate to pass down to his players.

item.title: Roosters forward Aliyah Nasio sent to judiciary over NRLW grand final brawl
item.description: Sydney Roosters forward Aliyah Nasio is facing a ban for throwing a punch in the brawl at the conclusion of the NRLW grand final.

item.title: Homicide investigation underway after man's body found in Bega park
item.description: Homicide detectives are investigating the discovery of a man's body on the New South Wales far south coast overnight.

item.title: Bushfire on Moreton Island, north of Brisbane, burns 2,300 hectares before being contained
item.description: Investigators believe the fire was sparked by a campfire lit on Saturday morning while an active fire ban was in place.
